3809.16.text: it's yours.  All art my darlings, my pilgrim, gypsy, misfit, maniacs.

3820.94.text: From the cave painting to today.

3824.36.text: Why? Because it all exists now for us in the present.

3830.30.text: Then we are gone, and it stays.

3833.30.text: And then it will become contemporary for the next. You have a shot

3838.84.text: you have a hundred year window on this thing.

3843.16.text: Everything is in play. That's how artists look at art, and the way they should.

3849.00.text: Here is what happens every morning on the phone in New York, or in your house.

3853.82.text: When I call my artists friends, or they call me and say,

3857.32.text: "how about the shows?" We only talk about art, we are the most boring people in the world."

3861.98.text: Nothing else, I talk about football a little.

3870.46.text: Redskins, oh, you are in a mess too.

3876.34.text: I'm okay with it, I'm a liberal.  Okay.

3880.30.text: When I talk to my friends about art,

3883.30.text: here is how the critic talks, I go

3885.48.text: "I liked this one the most, I thought this was the most derivative, this showed me the progress they were doing, la, la, la.

3893.24.text: I'm trying to understand, who have they looked at, how does this fit with their last show, and I'm working.

3900.52.text: I always want you to be working with your friends.

3903.08.text: Don't be a fancy smarty a** pants.

3906.94.text: You know, be yourself.  I'm asking you to be radically vulnerable.

3916.28.text: I want you to be as vulnerable as the object you are talking about,

3921.38.text: the person you are talking to. Okay?

3924.16.text: I tell my artist friends like, "blah blah blah" and then I'll say to them, "well what did you think?" and they'll go

3941.32.text: What they discovered when they got close to the d*** thing is that there was like little silicon mixed into the paint.

3949.72.text: They scratched some off, that's what they are bloody doing in there.

3955.36.text: That's what they should be doing. Who cares what the critics are looking at. They are right,

3962.32.text: artists are right. How something is made is what something is.

3968.54.text: There is the lack of separation again. See how the critic unconsciously stepped back,

3974.68.text: but we have, we are working in a different language.  Words, okay?

3978.92.text: I would tell artists, do everything. Everything.

3984.04.text: If you want to make movies, and slides, and Instagram, and paintings, and sculpture, and dog beds,

3993.12.text: Do it. There should be no line of investigation close to you.

4000.36.text: If you are thinking about making, but what about my consistency?

4004.38.text: I would say, get out of here.

4008.82.text: I'm not looking for more shows that look more or less the same.

4014.04.text: Here is how you all walk into a lot of shows.

4021.74.text: I want you my artists to fail flamboyantly.

4028.26.text: even if you are just making all grey paintings.

4034.18.text: to make those grey paintings yours, and yours alone.

4039.70.text: If I like this much, of one thing, in one show,

4047.98.text: That's all I need. [sniffs like a dog]

4052.66.text: One whiff of blood. [acts like dog]

4056.66.text: I could kill this person, I could eat them.

4062.56.text: You see, that's what the critics are thinking.

4065.52.text: Ahh, I can gain access to this.

4068.24.text: Whatever your obsession are, they better be near your work.

4073.56.text: They better maybe even be, if you love sewing, I need sewing in there.

4078.00.text: I met a kid out at

4080.56.text: Cal Arts, years back. He loved pornography, I said,

4085.16.text: "well, you know, it's kind of male."

4088.36.text: He then produced photographs, he loved it so much, he could identify each photographer of any pornographic shoot.

4097.68.text: I said, "you need pornography in your work."

4103.36.text: That was his obsession. Even if your obsession is just painting stripes,

4108.42.text: I don't know how it happens, a lot of artists paint stripes,

4111.94.text: and squares, and triangles, and flowers, and horses.  Horses!

4116.74.text: A lot of people have painted horses, what are you going to do?

4120.48.text: You don't choose your subject matter

4123.90.text: your subject matter is choosing you.

4127.38.text: Your subject matter is choosing you, you don't quite know how you got there.

4135.32.text: artists could spend a whole lifetime drawing the same composition.

4139.68.text: Did you see that old movie, Close Encounters of the Third Kind?

4143.36.text: You should see it, it's an artist parable.

4145.72.text: The lead character keeps walking around making a kind of mound shape,

4151.58.text: and all that he says to people is just what you idiot artists say,

4155.22.text: "this is important, this means something, this is important, this means something."

4162.32.text: Give yourself total permission, please. That's what the art world is, don't let yourself be policed

4170.42.text: in any way, shape, or form.

4175.44.text: or worse, you know, a psychopath.

4178.84.text: But in your work, you can be a sociopath.

4184.60.text: If Nabacough writes about Lolita, it does not make him a pedophile.

4191.64.text: If you think about rape, it doesn't mean you want to be raped, or you want to rape.

4196.82.text: We are in a new art world where if I violate the politically correct codes of our world,

4205.16.text: we are attacking ourselves, we are eating our young.

4209.88.text: Something is happening about certain kind of policing of our language.  Have any of you noticed that? I have,

4216.74.text: being in the center of a lot of storms.

4219.78.text: When I didn't like Oscar Murillo's work - Can I talk a little more, or is it time for questions?

4225.68.text: You know what? I'll keep blabbing, so I better stop.

4229.44.text: You nodded, yes, stop.  Your career is over!

4235.50.text: Alright, I'm going to drink some water,

4237.64.text: and I hope some of you have some questions. I'll tell you anything you want to know.

4242.10.text: How to get famous, what to do, where to go. Anything you ever want to know.

4246.48.text: Thank you for listening for the last hour.
